identificationModule.briefTitle: Intraoperative Epiaortic Scanning for Preventing Early Stroke After Off-pump Coronary Artery Bypass

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Recently epiaortic ultrasound scanning (EAS) has been recommended as an intraoperative tool to accurately assess ascending aorta disease. To date, several studies have reported that EAS is superior to TEE and surgical palpation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Early Stroke After Off-pump Coronary Artery Bypass
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: number of incidence of early strok from surgery to discharge, an expected average of 5 weeks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

patients underwent who isolated off-pump coronary artery bypass

Exclusion Criteria:

1. combined carotid procedures
2. preoperative cerebral haemorrhage
3. nonoperative unstable vital signs such as ventricular fibrillation or cardiac arrest
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: From January 2001 to December 2011, 2292 patients who underwent isolated off-pump coronary artery bypass at Yonsei Cardiovascular Hospital in Seoul
